subject: Re: Running test cases in eclipse at runtime workbench
msgSnippet: ... *In the button click event i have created an object for this test case class... *say Box extends Test case.... Box box=new Box(); *I have created an object
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "David Saff" <saff@...> wrote:
>
> On 4/4/07, shunmugam609 <shunmugam609@...> wrote:
> >
> > sample code:
> >
> > class Box extends TestCase
> > {
> > ....
> > ...
> > ..}
> > Box box=new Box();
>
>
>
> I can't automatically translate this to valid Java. Can you give a more
> explicit example? Thanks,
>
> David Saff
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>

--------------------------------------------------------------------
*In the button click event i have created an object for this test case
class...

*say Box extends Test case....

Box box=new Box();

*I have created an object for this box class in another class.

*How should i invoke this test case class box when say if i click a
button(any action event,button in my perspective)....

* i have called this box object inside another class function event
handler.

*is it enough if i write this line...

junit.textui.TestRunner.run(Box.class);

Inside that event handler.
...
i have done this before, But couldn't see the Test Case class being
invoked. Will this above line will call all the test methods including
setUp and tearDown methods itself.

*I debugged the flow control, I kept a breakpoint in this above line
but the flow control is not transferring to the Box class declaration
part and it's methods.

*I have written this code in the ordinary button action event...

*Help me to sort out this problem....

-shunmugam
